explanation.rules:
Morpheme Order: The structure of the verb is: Sb-Ob_dir-Ob_obl.

Person and Number Morphemes:
1st person sg:
    Ob_dir: s-
    Ob_obl: s-
1st person pl:
    Ob_dir: š’-
    Ob_obl: š’-
2nd person sg:
    Ob_dir: w-
    Ob_obl: w-
2nd person pl:
    Ob_dir: šʷ-
    Ob_obl: šʷ-
3rd person sg:
    Ob_dir: a-
    Ob_obl: ∅ (null)
    Sb: n-
3rd person pl:
    Ob_dir: a-
    Ob_obl: a-
    Sb: na-

Verb Stem and Suffixes:
The person/number prefixes are followed by the morpheme tʷ.
This is followed by a theme vowel, which is determined by a condition:
The vowel is a if: the Direct Object (Ob_dir) is plural, OR the 2nd person plural morpheme is used for either the Direct Object (Ob_dir) or the Oblique Object (Ob_obl).
Otherwise, the vowel is ə.
Finally, the verb form ends with the morpheme n.

Phonological Rule:
When two consonants, C1 and C2, are adjacent, a schwa (ə) is inserted between them. The sequence C1-C2 becomes C1-ə-C2.
